name: 'Process Stories' Online Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 4 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What famous philosopher did Sam keep quoting throughout the night?
questions.explanation:
Aristotle.

	Aristotle said that a probable impossibility is preferable to an improbable possibility. Sam was talking about Horton Wilde winning.

questions.text: How was Will going to celebrate the Horton Wilde victory?
questions.explanation:
Sleep.

	Will (to Elsie): "I'm going to sleep."

questions.text: Did the others convince Sam to run?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Josh (to Sam): "We're not going to let you look like a fool. We won't allow it."

questions.text: What was the name of the guy that ticked CJ off because of his interviews?
questions.explanation:
Chris.

	CJ: "Don't disrespect Leo McGarry or Bruno Gianelli."

questions.text: Who was the first staff member that Charlie let into Jed and Abbey's room?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	He came in the moment before Abbey came out wearing only a pajama top. Toby interrupted them later with news that Andy is pregnant and that he is the father.

questions.text: What state did Andy keep hollering out at her party?
Who did Josh feel lurking outside his office?
questions.explanation:
Donna.

	Josh had just finished talking to Amy about Sam running in the California 47th.

questions.text: Who got drunk and tried to pick up women at the party?
questions.explanation:
Bruno.

	Bruno used lines such as "I think it's helpful if lies come before sex" and "Losing makes you funny, winning makes you handsome."

questions.text: Who asked if they could come with Toby when he told the President about Andy's pregnancy?
questions.explanation:
CJ.

	CJ, Amy and Josh were out in the hallway when they ran into Toby, who was headed to the residence.

questions.text: Did Charlie want to have fun at the party?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Charlie (to Jed): "But I work for you."
